title: Part (a)
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions:
Student response does not accurately include the following criteria

Example Response:

Use a meterstick to measure the spring stretch – called x

Use a protractor to measure the angle of the ramp called (T)

Use a balance to measure the mass of the cart – called M

Use a balance to measure the mass of each additional mass added to the cart.

Student response accurately includes one of the following criteria

Use a balance to measure the mass of each additional mass added to the cart.

title: Part (b)
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions:
Student response does not accurately include any of the following criteria

Example Response:

Measure the angle (T) of the ramp with the horizontal with a protractor and measure the original length of the spring with a meterstick. Add more mass to the cart and for each set of mass, measure the additional stretch of the spring – the additional stretch above the original length is called – x. Repeat each measurement to reduce error. Repeat experiment for at least 5 different sets of masses.

Student response accurately includes one of the following criteria

Repeat each measurement to reduce error. Repeat experiment for at least 5 different sets of masses.

Repeat each measurement to reduce error. Repeat experiment for at least 5 different sets of masses.

Student response accurately includes three of the following criteria

Repeat each measurement to reduce error. Repeat experiment for at least 5 different sets of masses.

Repeat each measurement to reduce error. Repeat experiment for at least 5 different sets of masses.
